intro: Pithecellobium mexicanum, commonly known as the Mexican spurred orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers that resemble orchids. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with compound leaves and yellow or orange flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry climates. The fruit is a legume pod containing edible seeds that are sometimes used in traditional cuisine.
